info.name: Lumotive_REST_API
info.description: REST API for Lumotive M30 lidar system

item.name: /system_version

request.description: Gets the version information of the API, system hardware, and software.

item.description: Access versioning information for the API, Sensor Head and Compute hardware platforms, and software.

item.name: /sensor_id
item.description: Accesses the serial number of the sensor head.

item.name: /update

request.description: Switches the compute module into "Update Mode" to perform software updates. The update must be finalized in the browser. Please see the user manual for additional details.

item.description: Puts system in "Update Mode" to apply software and firmware updates.

item.name: /state

request.description: Retrieves the current state of the system. Possible return values are `READY`, `ENERGIZED`, and `SCANNING`.

item.description: Returns the operating state of the sensor head.

item.name: /start_scan

request.description: Starts the sensor head, including scanning the laser, detecting returns, and streaming point cloud data. This method will only be successful when the system is in the `ENERGIZED` state.

item.description: Controls sensor head scanning. Starts sensor head scanning with currently applied settings.

request.description: Stops the sensor head, including stopping laser scanning. This method will only be successful when the system is in the `ENERGIZED` or `SCANNING` states.

item.name: /scan_parameters

request.description: Gets the available scan configuration fields and their value bounds or options.

Sets the scan configuration for the sensor head. All fields must be defined when applying new scan settings.

The \\txtcode{user_tag} field can be used for determining when the new scan parameters have been applied by inspection of the value in the network stream. If values are not provided, they are randomized within the bounds of the value for each Virtualized Sensor.

The \\txtcode{laser_power_percent} and \\txtcode{inte_time_us} fields will be marshalled into an integer with a \\texttt{floor} operation. Therefore both 50.4 and 50.8 will result in an applied \\txtcode{laser_power_percent}=50 and 10.4 and 10.9 will result in an applied \\txtcode{inte_time_us}=10.

\\txtcode{frame_rate_hz} is floored to the nearest multiple of 10. Therefore a setting of 555 and 554.5 will both result in an applied \\txtcode{frame_rate_hz}=550.

response.name: /scan_parameters
/scan_parameters
/scan_parameters
response.body: "FAILED: HDR integration time must be less than the integration time setting but inte_time_us = 15 and hdr_inte_time_us = 16"

response.name: /scan_parameters
/scan_parameters

item.description: Configuration of custom scan patterns through a JSON structure. Field limits and definitions can be found in the document "lumotive-programmable-lidar-primer.pdf".

item.name: /persistent_settings
item.description: Gets and sets settings that persist across reboots of the system. These settings can be retrieved using a GET request; the result is a JSON structure containing all of the available persistent settings and their values. The persistent settings can be set individually or together by sending a POST request with the body containing a JSON structure containing one or more persistent settings and their corresponding values.

item.name: /restart
item.description: Restarts the sensor to return to the default `ENERGIZED` state.

item.name: /disable

response.name: /disable
response.body: "Disabled. System is ready to power down."

item.description: Stops scanning and disables power to the sensor head.

item.name: /mapping

request.description: Downloads a zip file of all the sensor head angular mapping tables in CSV format.

item.description:
Returns an unencrypted zipfile containing CSV files of per-pixel angular mapping constants. This mapping table can be used to calculate (X,Y,Z) coordinates from the network stream.

In normal operation, these tables do not need to be downloaded: the sensor-head-specific tables are sent over the network and automatically used by the ROS driver.

item.name: /logs

request.description: Returns an encrypted zipfile containing M20 system logs and diagnostic data.

item.description: Downloads system logs for debugging by Lumotive.

item.name: /messages

request.description: Gets an array of status messages.
Gets the status of a sensor head update.

item.description: Endpoints to retrieve messages from the API.

item.name: /time_sync_status
item.description: Endpoint that provides useful status information about time synchronization
